versioning.note: Each API family has its own version. eBay versions are stable; breaking changes trigger a major version bump.

api_groups.name: Fulfillment API
api_groups.description: Retrieve and manage buyer orders and shipments for sold items.

api_groups.name: Inventory API
api_groups.description: Create and manage inventory items (products), offers (listings), and inventory locations.

api_groups.name: Account API
api_groups.description: Manage seller account settings: payment policies, return policies, fulfillment policies.

api_groups.name: Analytics API
api_groups.description: Access traffic reports, sales performance, and listing quality data.

api_groups.name: Browse API
api_groups.description: Search and retrieve public catalog data (product details, prices, descriptions). Uses application token — no seller auth required.

api_groups.name: Taxonomy API
api_groups.description: Navigate eBay category trees and retrieve category-specific item aspects.

auth.summary: Standard OAuth2 — Client Credentials for public APIs, Authorization Code for seller APIs

pagination: Offset-based (limit + offset) or cursor-based (next link in response) depending on the endpoint

sandbox.note: Full sandbox with separate credentials. Register test accounts at developer.ebay.com/my/keys.

common_gotchas: Two different OAuth flows are needed: Client Credentials (application token) for Browse/Taxonomy, Authorization Code (user token) for Sell APIs.
Inventory items (product data) and Offers (listings with price/quantity) are separate entities — you must create both.
An offer must be 'published' to be live on eBay. Creating an offer does not make it visible.
Use bulkCreateOrReplaceInventoryItem and bulkPublishOffer for catalog sync — individual calls are rate-limited.
The marketplace ID must be passed as the X-EBAY-C-MARKETPLACE-ID header on most sell endpoints.
